result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy S Deschler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 1 year, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $300 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

records.addlTxt: for warrant and commitment order with attached affidavit in support of warrant and commitment order

Case called @ 1:14 p.m. Defendant Jeremy S Deschler in court, in custody, appears via video.  Ruth Zouski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zouski - no payment plan has been established. Statement by the DE. Court finds contempt. Court orders: 60 days WCJ - I/S - Purge conditions: $100 for release from custody, $50 monthly starting June 1, 2016.
In WC Jail

Case called @ 1:53 p.m. Defendant Jeremy S Deschler in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 3-5 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Goldin. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 18 mos Probation - Conditions: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 1 year, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed. Appeal rights given. 

15TR2827 - Upon motion of the State the Court amends to Intermediate Speeding - 19 MPH Over. Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court orders: $250.90 forfeiture w/ 60 DTP or PP.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-14-2015 02:00 pm

9:33 am case called. Defendant Jeremy S Deschler in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Goldin-matter will not be a plea/sentencing as renegotiation needs to occur. Statement by ADA Anderson-has not objection for one adjournment but if matter not resolved, trial to be set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-03-2015 09:30 am

Per Def - has just retained counsel in Madison, add'l time need to pay retainer and complete paperwork.  Court schedules in person STC which counsel must attend with him. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:09 PM: Defendant Jeremy S Deschler in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - states he will retain his own counsel.  Based upon earnings, Court believes that Def will not qualify for SPD services.  Court will proceed with the understanding that counsel will be retained.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
